comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
35179849@N08
comment._content: where is this photo taken ?  The gradient of the bridge looks quite steep,  if I didn't know the date,  I'd think it might be near the spot where the Cahill expressway turns left over the station.    What street are they standing on ?

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Ralph Freeman (Harbour Bridge designer and consulting engineer to Dorman Long & Co) was in Sydney in April 1926...he appears in a couple of other pics of Harbour Bridge construction work taken in April 1926...but I can't see him in this group. I suspect we also see a couple of the unidentified chaps in this PHM pic www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8283760394/ ; the chap 2nd from the left in the above SRNSW pic might also be the chap on the far left in this PHM pic www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8283755426/ ; I can't identify any NSW Cabinet ministers here (1st Lang ministry, 1925-27)
